entry.title: Chora Overview
entry.heading: Overview
entry.para: Chora is a tool for viewing code repositories that are managed using the CVS source control system. It aims to provide a high degree of integration with CVS and the other Horde web-based tools. It provides a directory (file) view, a log history view, difference views between versions, a visual branch view, and an annotated view.

entry.title: Menu Buttons: Problem?
entry.heading: Problem?
entry.para: The Problem? button brings up a form to report a problem to your system administrator. Use this to get help if you are having a problem.

entry.title: Menu Buttons: Options
entry.heading: Options
entry.para: The Options button lets you set some personal preferences to control the way Chora behaves.

entry.title: Menu Buttons: Logout
entry.heading: Logout
entry.para: The Logout menu button will log you out of the web portal. After you change your password, you must logout and back in before things will work again.

entry.title: Menu Buttons: Help
entry.heading: Help
entry.para: The Help button brings up this help display.

entry.title: Menu Buttons: Chora
entry.heading: Chora Button
entry.para: The Chora button takes you back to the main Chora files view for the default repository.

entry.title: CVS Checkout View
entry.heading: CVS Checkout View
entry.para: The Checkout View shows a file contents at a revision point, along with the log entry for that revision.

entry.title: Annotate View
entry.heading: Annotated View
entry.para: The Annotated View shows a file annotated with which authors are responsible for which portions of a file's contents (and is hence often called the "blame" view).

entry.title: Branch View
entry.heading: Branch (History) View
entry.para: The Branch View shows a file's version history, layed out by branches. This allows you to visually see where branch points were created in the tree.

entry.title: Log View
entry.heading: Log View
entry.para: The Log View shows a file's history via the checkin log messages. This allows you to see a history of changes from the point of view log messages entered at checkin time.

entry.title: Differences View
entry.heading: Differences View
entry.para: The Differnences View shows the differences between two different revisions of a file. This allows you to easily see how a file has changed. You can view the differences in various formats, including among others a color coded side by side listing of the two revisions, or in terms of ed editor commands.

entry.title: Show/Hide Deleted Files
entry.heading: Show/Hide Deleted Files
entry.para: You can choose to either view deleted files (from the Attic) or to not show (hide) deleted files in the cvs file view. If you choose to show deleted files, they will show up dimmed and with a trash can icon.
The default is not to show deleted files.
